chapter.title: Home Folder
chapter.para: After you log in, more folders are accessible to you. First of all, you have a Home folder. When you click on your Home folder, note that the path shown in the search panel is not /resources/Home, but "/resources/users/" followed by your full username.

The Home folder is represented in bold typeface. Folders with bold typeface are folders that you have rights to write to, this is, folders that you can save records to and folders the contents of which you are allowed to edit. If other users allow you to write to their folders, these folders will also appear in bold in the Folder View when you log in.

All the other folders, that is, all the folders that have a light greyed-out appearance, are folders you can read only. You can retrieve the contents of these folders, but not change the records in them or add new records to them.

In addition to these two types of folders, there are many folders that you simply cannot see. These are folders that belong to other users that have not been made viewable by everyone by their owners or folders that have not been shared by their owner with a group that you are a member of.
If you hover above a shared folder with your insertion point, a tooltip explains who the folder in question is shared with.
More will be said about folder sharing below.
